item.content:
Author: Asato Asato
Artist: Suzume Somemiya
Genres: Romance, Slice of Life
TV Rating: PG

ğŸ§­ Story & Pacing

This is a fun alternate take on the 86 characters, placing them in a typical Japanese high school setting. It doesnâ€™t connect to the main series canon, but all the character quirks and charm are still present. It’s a standalone volume, self-contained with 16 chapters and a character list at the end. The pace is light and easy, with a comfortable slice-of-life flow.

ğŸ‘¥ Characters

The main focus is on:

  • Lena â€“ Student Council President
  • Shin â€“ Quiet but reliable

The story builds on the developing bond between Lena and Shin, leaning into sweet and subtle romantic moments. Other familiar characters make appearances too.

ğŸ¨ Art & Paneling

The art follows a clean, standard manga style. Itâ€™s easy to follow with good panel flow and expressive characters, sticking to classic shoujo/slice-of-life visuals.

ğŸ­ Themes & Tone

The manga reimagines the core 86 cast in a lighthearted school setting. The tone is playful and romantic, with no war or politicsâ€”just uniforms, student council meetings, and teenage awkwardness.

ğŸ’­ Personal Thoughts

Itâ€™s an easy, enjoyable read with no complex plotlines. Iâ€™d love to see more volumes like this in the futureâ€”itâ€™s a great “what if” side story.

â­ï¸ Final Rating
